newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian bonds narrow sharply vs dlr bloc.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian bonds narrow sharply vs dlr bloc.

text.p: Australian bond spreads narrowed sharply to their dollar bloc counterparts as the short-end sped ahead on the recent strength of the Australian dollar, which sparked hopes of another cut in official interest rates.
The local yield curve also steepened as the long-end continued to do battle at resistance around the 7.0 percent yield barrier on the benchmark 10-year bond.
However, the Australian/U.S. 10-year yield spread tightened to below 90 basis points at one stage, although this is also proving an obstacle.
U.S. Treasuries remained around their slightly softer levels seen in New York during Tokyo trading, having met resistance after this week's overall firm tone.

The local market outpaced Canadian debt, which was fairly mixed on Thursday as its yield curve steepened on speculation of another easing by the Bank of Canada after a weaker than expected retail sales report.
The New Zealand market was firm, also taking its cue from a firm local currency, but still underperformed against Australia.
